details.reasoning: User wants to post a message to Slack. The slack_post_message action maps directly to Slack's chat.postMessage and requires channel and text. We have slack_channel for the target and summary for the message content, satisfying required fields.
details.rendered_config: { "channel": "#product-alerts", "text": "Found 3 products. Average price: $91.66. Lowest: USB-C Hub ($45.00)" }

details.request: Add these products to my Notion database
details.reasoning: The user wants to add multiple products as entries in a Notion database. Creating database entries corresponds to creating pages in the target database. The 'notion_create_page' action is appropriate per the Notion Create Page API. The config loops over scraper_results to generate one page payload per product, mapping Name (title), Price (number), and URL (url) to typical database properties.
details.proposed_config: [{% for product in scraper_results %}{ "parent": { "database_id": "{{ notion_database_id }}" }, "properties": { "Name": { "title": [ { "text": { "content": "{{ product.name }}" } } ] }, "Price": { "number": {{ product.price }} }, "URL": { "url": "{{ product.url }}" } } }{% unless forloop.last %}, {% endunless %}{% endfor %}]

  "selected_action": "github_create_issue",
  "reasoning": "The user wants to open a GitHub issue to track a failed scrape. The available actions include 'github_create_issue', which matches the request. Per the GitHub Create Issue API, the payload must include a title and can optionally include a body and labels. I used the provided variables 'summary' and 'error_details' to populate a clear issue body with Markdown formatting and added helpful labels. The configuration is a Liquid template t

details.request: Add these results to the existing spreadsheet
details.reasoning: The user wants to add rows to an existing spreadsheet and a spreadsheet_id is provided. The google_sheets_append action (spreadsheets.values.append) is appropriate for appending rows. The config uses the provided spreadsheet_id, targets a standard range (Sheet1!A:C), sets valueInputOption to USER_ENTERED, and loops over scraper_results to build the 2D values array.
details.proposed_config: { "spreadsheetId": "{{ spreadsheet_id }}", "range": "Sheet1!A:C", "valueInputOption": "USER_ENTERED", "values": [{% for product in scraper_results %}["{{ product.name }}", {{ product.price }}, "{{ product.url }}"]{% unless forloop.last %}, {% endunless %}{% endfor %}] }
